page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The name Albury,(a main village in this area),was first recorded as Eldeberie,then later as Audebir (in 1230) and more recently by the name of Albury.This means 'Old Burh' or 'Ealda's Burh'. The main building of historical interest is Albury Church of which the oldest part was built in the 13th century.The nave was built in the 14th century and the rood screen (a screen separating the main part of the church from the altar) was built in 1400. There are 6 bells and 2 memorial brasses are to be found on the floor. There used to be a disused windmill just outside the main street of Little Hadham but the owner burnt it down due to the great cost of restoring it.
